system.description:
Cataphracts are armored horse riding warriors clad in steel and brigandine, carrying spears and shields to move across the field and break ranks.

(The stats provided here is for a Rank 1 encounter. Check the book for higher ranks.)
system.attacks:
Inflict Violence: Dragoncharge. Attack an adjacent enemy with Bravery and then slow them.

Gambits [[/r d4]]

1: Rush > Inflict Violence > Rush

2: Rush > Inflict Violence > Dragon Guard [1]: Taunt all enemies in burst 2 until the end of the Cataphractâ€™s next riff.

3: Rush > Lightning Spills From The Goblet [2]: Fly 2 and then attack all enemies in burst 1 with Bravery.

4: Dragonspear [3]: Move 7 tiles in a straight line, through enemies. Inflict 1 True Hit and slow all enemies moved through.

traits.name: Conviction
traits.description: All Folk have a reason for fighting, and if reasoned to, can cause them to rethink combat. However, they will fight for their Conviction until it looks like all is bleak.

traits.name: Morale
traits.description: At the beginning of any Resound where there are twice as many Kadungganan than there are enemies (eg., If there are 4 Kadungganan and 2 Enemies left) all Folk enemies will Surrender, becoming Defeated.

traits.name: Heirs of the Dragon
traits.description: When a Baikhan fighter starts their riff, they and all adjacent Baikhan are ignited until the end of their next riff. All Ignited Baikhan have +1d to all Attack and Defense dice. Ignited Baikhan cannot be ignited again.

traits.name: Shi
traits.description: The Cataphract is mounted: all melee attacks with Bravery against the Cataphract suffer -1d and are considered on +1 Elevation. When the Cataphract ignites, the Cataphract and all ignited fighters gain Block 2.
